text: I dont know where I'm goin'...... But I sure know where I've been.......
author: VG Remasters

text: i played this as a Child and my most memorable thing about it was that they took away my lightsaber :( I should start this game again and play it through
author: MrManAlter

text: I loved how I could recognize this theme after not playing this game for over a Decade... The Power of Music!
author: 60secondrhymes

text: This is hands down one of the best games of all time. One of my most cherished memories were made on this game.
author: Canonmentos

text: I'm getting a golden sun vibe from this one :)
author: Momo

text: Didn't like the battle system, so i gave up on it before even finishing disc 1. Graphics and sound were very good though.
author: JZA the Jenius

text: One of the most amazing games ever made.
author: nighteel

text: Listening to this while watching the 24/7 Earth from Space live stream was the best idea I ever had.
author: Oxycominum

text: This game definitely had some of the most memorable and enjoyable game music I had heard up to that point in my life.  This would be a game I'd love to experience for the first time again.
author: notyoursavior78

text: Back when Sakuraba's sound was so fresh. I still think this soundtrack holds up incredibly well. Shame nothing else he has written lately does.
author: jb1980ist

text: While I do think this and his earlier works are his best I wouldn't sell ALL of his recent stuff short. I guess Dark Souls has been out for a good bit now (time flies) but I'd still consider it fairly recent. There isn't a whole lot of music in Dark Souls but what there is is pretty special. I think he's at his best when he composes dreamlike and melancholic music which SO2 and Dark Souls have in spades
author: Asuka0242

text: My hard drive recently died, taking with it a list of games I wanted to try after hearing examples of their music in your list. It sucks, but it could be a good excuse to start listening again from the beginning.
author: shoopdawhoop34

text: So good, gives me chills. Wish Sakuraba could still make music this amazing. Been having a urge to replay this, for probably the 5th time, luckily I still own my original copy and saves, with like 80% of the voice clips.
author: bloodyangel1

text: Sakuraba's music in this game had such a great identity, giving the game a magical, dream-like atmosphere. It's not just the great melodies, but the instrumentation. I've only played this game once when it released, yet I remember the music and the locales almost perfectly. That's always a good sign. This simple yet memorable theme is a good example.
author: SupraDarky

text: SupraDarky I wish I found it as memorable as you did, I recall nothing about locations or even music even though I'm a Sakuraba fan. But this theme does sound great!
author: Arthur Dorr

text: I'd say Sakuraba was on his prime during the PS1 era when it comes to soundtracks, he kinda lost identiy with his recent works but they still sound good, just not as identifiable as he was back then
author: Maxo14

text:
Very good story, great world design, Good Character design. Great challenges. Good Combat(Although slightly wonky), great soundtrack.

Now I hope Star Ocean 5 gets a good lookback to the first and second Star Ocean(Third was okay too! Just very padded out)
author: Vordox

text: when people let sakuraba do his thing he can still put out some nice sounding stuff, i quite liked his stuff from the zestiria soundtrack though it was super wasted on that game.
author: jsh020
